data.name: Wizard
data.description: Short’s first barley wine is a force to be reckoned with! From its batch number, to its identical boil time of 6hrs and 66mins, this deep dark amber ale holds some epic warming flavor. A monstrous malt bill creates a full bodied behemoth with high residual malty sweetness of caramel and toffee. These colossal flavors are then enhanced by ample additions of raisins during fermentation. Every Halloween we release a barrel aged version that takes on favorable vanilla and burnt oak qualities.

style.name: American-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: American style barley wines range from amber to deep copper-garnet in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by assertive bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor are at medium to very high levels. American type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Very low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. A caramel and/or toffee aroma and flavor are often part of the character. Characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, are not generally acceptable in American-style Barley Wine Ale, however if a low level of age-induced oxidation character harmonizes and enhances the overall experience this can be regarded favorably. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Short's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In April of 2004 we opened the doors to Short’s Brewing Company in the quaint Village of Bellaire.  Beer was the mission, and liberation was the movement.  With a lot of elbow grease, blind ambition and a little luck, the quest to create a community pub in Northwest Lower Michigan began to take shape.  The philosophy was to bring an appreciation of craft beer to the north with product education and creativity.  The process of appreciation through education we call beer liberation.

Today Short’s Brewing Company continues the effort to educate and liberate consumers.  We take pride in our hands on, mom and pop approach and the energy we put into the quality of our beer, food, staff, customers and facilities. We believe in the power of the smallness.   We intend on remaining a smaller, state wide beer distributor and focusing our energies close to home (the SBC Michigan stimulus package).  Our goal is to get to a comfortable production volume, enjoy what we do and love life in Northern Michigan.

data.name: Wolfs Breath Winter Warmer
data.description: Its strong malty taste, and dark roasted color is balanced by hop bitterness and sweet aroma. Barley wine is anything but a new style, as it dates back to the Middle Ages. This beer is known for its high alcohol and smooth drink ability.

breweries.name: Trinity Brewhouse
breweries.description:
Always fresh, always crisp.
Crafted with the finest quality hops from around the world, and filtered Scituate Reservoir water from right here in Little Rhody.

The beers, ales, porters and stouts available at the Brewhouse Pub are brewed on premises - ensuring a high quality product that is always satisfying and never flat.

Our Brewmaster takes great pride in providing our customers with the freshest beer in the city.
If we were any fresher...you'd slap us!

Stop by for a pint or two in house - or grab a Growler To Go and enjoy great Trinity Brewhouse Beer at your own leisure.

data.name: Woody B
data.description: Brewed with Jeff Crabtree’s homegrown Zeus, Fuggle, Cascade, Nugget & Centennial hops. Aromatic, and well-balanced barley wine ale aged Pinot Noir barrels for a year. Only 585 750 ML bottles were corked and caged.

breweries.name: Crabtree Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Crabtree Brewing Company is dedicated to serving the environment, the community, our customers, and our valued employees.  Requiring the best ingredients to support unique premium beers.  Keeping a dynamic business mind while remaining modestly profitable.   Employing technology, embracing ethics, growing to meet the needs of our customers and employees, and having fun doing what we love - Making Great Beer.

The Crabtree Brewing Company, ltd. is a Colorado based company providing premium ale, wheat, stout, and lager style beers. Established in 2006, this is the first micro-brewery located within Greeley, Colorado.

data.name: XV
data.description:
Barleywine Ale is a traditionally brewed beer but has the alcohol content more akin to that of wine.  Along with the higher alcohols come many fruity flavors common in wine.  These fruity alcohols and yeast esters are balanced by a fresh bouquet of flowery, citrusy hops.  Brewed in celebration of 15 years, XV was brewed with 15 different malts and 15 different hops, and hopped every 15 minutes over a two hour boil.  The result is a complex ale packed with flavor and alcohol.  Great with rich desserts or alone as a digestif.

Served in an 8oz Brandy snifter glass only. Cheers to Fifteen Years.

breweries.name: Fox River Brewing Company
breweries.description: Dating back to 1846, the city of Oshkosh has deep roots in brewing fine beers http://oshkoshbeertimeline.blogspot.com/. Fox River Brewing Company opened on the Fox River in Oshkosh, late 1995. Under the name of Fratellos (meaning brothers) and Fox River Brewing Co., the Supple Brothers, long-standing restaurateurs, dove into the brewing industry.

breweries.name: Birrificia Le Baladin
breweries.description: It is the place where it all started. There would be much to say and tell it to start back over the key dates. In 1986, Teo decides, with his partner then Michelle, a pretty young French dancer, to open in Piozzo, a small town unknown to the door of the Langhe where he was born, a "creperie"! He rents a former "tavern" with an attached mini apartment on the top floor and a gravel courtyard on the back and opens its doors. At first, his passion for beer, and a little 'light his aversion for wine led him to fill the menu with more than two hundred references international beers, as well as dainties to enjoy to work alongside the crepes. Gradually, the goodness of the choices made ​​good name and port customers to small local baptized "Le Baladin" by his friend François of CIRQUE BIDON in homage to the nature of Teo same. Years went by and the room expands, you change, you will see a big circus tent to cover the courtyard paved with gravel now tables and chairs in style "Oktoberfest" and hand in hand also changes his mentor: Nora is now its new companion and muse together and decide a new course of the local : transform the creperie in a brewpub! After months of study and travel with Nora to discover Belgian brewers have our hero returns with huge bins loaded onto a van Volkswagen Westfalia and places them in the garage of the ousted former owner of the house, adjacent to the restaurant, now transformed into a microbrewery. So begins the adventure productive BEER BALADIN that sees just two beers "taxes" to the regulars who frequent the pub goers somewhat perplexed and embarrassed to taste these first, honestly a bit 'adventurous productions Teo. Over time, the production will be moved to other places for sizing issues and logistics, but still the aura of magic that permeated the early days of the brewery remains unchanged. Today, large kitchen has taken the place of the production and in the pub beers are on tap now classic carnet baladiniano as well as all production in the bottle. Occasionally a few small tweaks gives customers reason of surprise and veiled "Amarcord" in which one of them remembers the beginnings of this place, now a destination for "pilgrimage" by many fans of the beer world. It is always a place where good food is accompanied not only by our beers but by good music and by the sympathy of the staff who always has a smile for everyone and where it is customary to a friendly "welcome", a hello and a good day to all those who pass through it if only for a small beer refreshing.

data.name: Yeti
data.description:
– Iced Barley Wine –
This is yet another off the wall idea we decided to put into action. We make our American Barley Wine (Paul Bunyan) and let it finish fermenting like normal. Then we wait for a particularly frigid evening and move the entire one barrel fermenter outside overnight. This basically freezes a portion of the water in the beer and when kegging the beer the following morning this water is left behind. The result is a more concentrated version of our already rather powerful beer. This is the king of all giants, and certainly the most dangerous.

style.name: American-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: American style barley wines range from amber to deep copper-garnet in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by assertive bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor are at medium to very high levels. American type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Very low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. A caramel and/or toffee aroma and flavor are often part of the character. Characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, are not generally acceptable in American-style Barley Wine Ale, however if a low level of age-induced oxidation character harmonizes and enhances the overall experience this can be regarded favorably. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: One Barrel Brewing
breweries.description: Madison's smallest brewery opened on Friday, July 6 2012. One Barrel Brewing Company is at the intersection of Atwood and Winnebago streets, a.k.a. Schenk's Corners, it's like a coffee shop, only with beer instead of coffee". With a staple of No. 2 Strong Ale, other usual suspects include Penguin Pale Ale (a Belgian pale ale), and The Commuter (a Kölsch-style ale), but the small brew system will allows up to 10 beers on tap at a time, constant rotation of new brews.

breweries.name: Ei8ht Ball Brewing
breweries.description:
Ei8ht Ball, named after the streets we got our
credit from, we are humble yet proud. Local but not
influenced. We might not move mountains, but we will
push the envelope. We will test theories and create
moments through our liquid in which tones and times
are our muse. We will brew and flow with poise and
confidence. We will rush for no one, yet hesitate for
nothing. We strive to please but make no apologies. No
billboards, neon lights and flashy text, it’s not our speed.
Make us part of your flight or enjoy us with a meal and
the mission is complete. For all of those in search of
something diverse, unique, improved and fresh, look
into, behind, under and around the Ei8ht Ball. What you
will find is what you never thought you were looking for.
This is Ei8ht Ball Brewing, the proof is the glass.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

data.name: §ucaba (Abacus)
data.description: Big boozy bourbon and American oak aromas combined with soft chocolate malty undertones. Complex malt flavors framed in oak, with hints of dark chocolate, vanilla, tobacco, coconut and just a touch of dark cherry. This is definitely a sipping beer, best served in a brandy snifter. This ale pairs well with dark chocolate and sturdy cheeses.
data.foodPairings: This ale pairs well with dark chocolate and sturdy cheeses.

breweries.name: Firestone Walker Brewing Company
breweries.description: Founded in 1996 by Adam Firestone (aka the Bear) & David Walker (aka the Lion), Firestone Walker Brewing Company began as a small brewery with roots in wine country on California’s Central Coast. Now a regional brewery, our singular purpose remains – to craft ever better beer.  Passionately in pursuit of the perfect beer…and never satisfied.

data.name: ‘BARLEY LEGAL’ BARLEYWINE
data.description: Massive amounts of hops (3x the amount that goes in the IPA!!!) are needed to counter the massive grain bill that goes into this one! A very smooth and well rounded experience.

breweries.description:
Micro Brewery, Restaurant, and Pub. Serving hand crafted ales and fine food using the freshest ingredients the kitchen is open from 11 am to 9pm but we keep serving until everyone has had dinner.

Come in and enjoy our delicious food and drinks.
